dt: {bc}to set up for use or service

dt.t: had an exhaust fan {wi}installed{/wi} in the kitchen

dt: {bc}to induct into an office, rank, or order
{bc}to place in an office or dignity by seating in a stall or official seat
{bc}to establish in an indicated place, condition, or status

dt.t: {wi}installing{/wi} herself in front of the fireplace

dt: {bc}to be set up for use or service {bc}to undergo installation

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}enstaller, installer{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}installare{/it}, from Latin {it}in-{/it} + Medieval Latin {it}stallum{/it} stall, from Old High German {it}stal{/it}
shortdef: to set up for use or service
to induct into an office, rank, or order
to place in an office or dignity by seating in a stall or official seat
